alert.note: Alert for Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:56PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Coke, northern Sterling and western Nolan Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 755 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Forsan, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roscoe, Champion, Silver, Sanco and I-20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.
